required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Intravenous Gamma Globulin on Guillain-Barre Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: An Observational Cohort Study on the Efficacy of Intravenous Gamma Globulin on Guillain-Barre Syndrome
clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital of Fujian Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Guillain-barre syndrome (GBS) is an acute immune-mediated polyneuropathy. Intravenous Gamma globulin is an effective therapy.Although high doses of gamma globulin are clinically effective, the patient's recovery and clinical prognosis vary. The establishment of a cohort study on the therapeutic effect of gamma globulin in Guillain-barre Syndrome is beneficial to the diagnosis of the disease and to the understanding of the natural course of the disease and the efficacy of drug treatment.

primary_outcome.description: GBS disability scale ( Guillain-Barré syndrome disability scale) was defined as follows: 0: healthy state; 1: minor symptoms and capable of running; 2: able to walk 5 meters or more without assistance but unable to run; 3: able to walk 5 meters across an open space with help; 4: bedridden or chair-bound; 5: requiring assisted ventilation for at least part of the day; 6: dead

study_pop.textblock: Patients with GBS after standard IVIg treatment in relation to slow clinical course or worse outcome

overall_official.affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital of Fujian Medical University

facility.name: Department of Neurology,First Affiliated Hospital of Fujian Medical University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital of Fujian Medical University
